citeinfo.origin: Gerald A. Sanger of the Northwest Fisheries Center, National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
citeinfo.title: Tufted Puffin (Lunda cirrhata)

abstract.p: This is a characteristic species of the boreal Pacific Ocean. The breeding distribution cuts an enormous arch around the northern part of the Pacific Ocean from adjoining countries to overseas countries, from Peter the Great Bay and northern Hokkaido, as far as the Santa Barbara Islands and Baja California. In the north it breeds as far as Cape Lisburn and in the Kolyuchin Islands in the Southern Okhotsk Sea.

An excerpt from Chapter 1, "Sketches on the distribution and migrations of different species of marine birds." Pages 92-97, including 2 figures translated by Gerald Sanger available at the NOAA Seattle NMML Library.

[Reference: V. P. Shuntov, "Marine birds and the biological structure of the ocean," Pacific Ocean Research Institute of Fisheries and Oceanography (TINRO), Far East Book Publishers, Vladivostok, 1972.] (V. P. Shuntov, "Morskiye ptitsy i biologicheskaya struktvra okeana ," TIKHOOKEANSKI NAUKHNO-ISSLEDOVATYEL'SKI INSTITUT RYBNOGO KHOZYAISTVA I OKEANOGRAAFII (TINRO)

descript.purpose: A general report on the Tufted Puffin.
